title: Cotgrave Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Kate Jewell / Cotgrave colliery site
images.caption: Cotgrave colliery site in 2006. This colliery closed in 1993 and there is little left on the surface to show what was once here apart from an old railway track (middle distance) and air vent covers (left). A large proportion of the site was developed into the country park along the Grantham Canal which follows the line of the trees. Some of the site has been redeveloped as a light industry estate on Holygate Lane.

images.title: Kate Jewell / Lock 6 on the Grantham Canal
images.caption: Lock 6 on the Grantham Canal. Fully restored under the Cotgrave regeneration programme. The canal passes through Cotgrave Country Park on this stage in its journey between Grantham and the River Trent.

images.title: Kate Jewell / Cotgrave Country Park
images.caption: This boulder looks like something dropped from outer space but actually is to stop off roaders accessing this Country Park track.

images.title: Russ Hamer, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Park lake.

description: This lovely country park near Nottingham is the perfect place for a peaceful cycle or walk. The park includes woodland, wetland, lakes and informal grassland while the Grantham canal also runs through the park. You could continue your exercise along the Grantham Canal and visit the nearby village of Hickling where there's a nice canalside pub. If you head a couple of miles north where you'll find the Holme Pierrepont Country Park and Colwick Country Park . Cotgrave is located just a few miles south east of Nottingham city centre, near the market town of West Bridgford .
